data: Restricted to Department of Palliative Care
Patient does NOT have an implantable defibrillator

Periopertive status: Maintain Documented Resuscitation Status, During chemotherapy: Maintain Documented Resuscitation Status, Discussion with patient regarding implantable defibrillator as per patient wishes: Turn off tachycardia detection (will stop shocks but not bradycardia pacing) - call patient's EP physician or physician on-call during business hours, use magnet after hrs

Periopertive status: Maintain Documented Resuscitation Status, During chemotherapy: Maintain Documented Resuscitation Status, Discussion with patient regarding implantable defibrillator as per patient wishes: Implantable defibrillator to be left on, review PRN with patient

Discussion with patient regarding implantable defibrillator as per patient wishes: Turn off tachycardia detection (will stop shocks but not bradycardia pacing) - call patient's EP physician or physician on-call during business hours, use magnet after hrs
Discussion with patient regarding implantable defibrillator as per patient wishes: Implantable defibrillator to be left on, review PRN with patient
Contact most responsible physician if patient exhibits any of the following: Anxiety, restlessness, pale skin, diaphoresis, decreasing level of consciousness and IV site problems
T;N, Dry weight for drug calculations in kg
Prior to initiation, then q30mins for 2 hours after initiation and with every dose titration (increase or decrease), then q6h until infusion discontinued
Prior to initiation, then q30mins for 2 hours after initiation and with every dose titration (increase or decrease), then q6h until infusion discontinued
Titrate O2 to keep SpO2 92% or greater. Prior to initiation, then q30mins for 2 hours after initiation and with every dose titration (increase or decrease), then q6h until infusion discontinued
DOBUTamine titratable infusion (5 mg/mL) in D5W
